Mark Kelly did not take a Chinese commun: He traveled with a banner made for him commemorating his space flight and his participation in young leaders conferences.
The National Committee on U: S.-China Relations confirmed that China did not pay for Kelly's participation in the forum, and the interaction with a Chinese institute was only for administrative purposes.
Martha McSally: s claim that Kelly went on a Chinese-government funded trip to the forum is not supported by the evidence provided by her campaign.
Kelly: s participation in the Young Leaders Forum was part of an annual program by the National Committee on U.S.-China Relations, which aims to encourage mutual understanding between citizens of both countries. The forum alternates between China and the United States each year.
